title: It works!

Vods are in one piece, and I can click anywhere and it loads from that point without seizing up, which is a godsend. I needed to update MX Player and have a Twitch account for it to work, so if something's not working for you, try looking into those first before you blame this one for your problems.

title: works!
comment: It works for me. The VODs without sound are there because of twitch, not because of this app (twitch deletes big chunks of audio from VODs when they detect licensed music). My issue is that many VODs can't be viewed in source quality unless I switch to software decoding in MX player, which heats up my S4 like a frying pan and drains away battery pretty quickly. Other than that, it's a great app that does what it says it does.

title: Light on features, heavy on performance
comment: [Note: Streaming using the most recent version of MX Player and VLC Media Player.] This app does two things and does them well. It lets you quickly see if your favorite streams are on and plays them. If that's all you want, this is the app you want. It could use some features like notifications for when steamers come online, game lists and chat. However if they are added, better to have them done well or not done at all. 4/5. Good start.
